lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Main class for running the whole program
* This method runs program Duke by reading in commands and executing them
* A class represents a command type of Add Deadline Task
* Adds a deadline task to the ArrayList tasks
* @param storage Storage to load and save the data file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns false to indicate the program continues running
* A class represents a command type of Add Event Task
* Adds an Event task to the ArrayList tasks
* @param storage Storage to load and save the data file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns false to indicate the program continues running
* A class represents a command type of Add Todo Task
* Adds a todo task to the ArrayList tasks
* @param storage Storage to load and save the data file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns false to indicate the program continues running
* Exits Duke and saves all the newly added tasks
* @param storage Storage to load and save the data file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns true to indicate the program stops running
* A class represents all types of command
* A method executes according type of command based on user input
* @param storage Storage to load and save the data file
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Returns boolean isExit to indicate whether the command ends the program
* A class represents a command type of Delete Task
* Deletes a task in the ArrayList tasks
* @param storage Storage to load and save the data file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns false to indicate the program continues running
* A class represents a command type of Done Task
* Marks a task as done in the ArrayList tasks
* @param storage Storage to load and save the data file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns false to indicate the program continues running
* A class represents a command type of Find Task
* Finds a task in the ArrayList tasks
* @param storage Storage to load and save the data file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns false to indicate the program continues running
* A class represents a command type of List Task
* Lists all tasks in the ArrayList tasks
* @param storage Storage to load and save the data file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns false to indicate the program continues running
* A class that parses each command from user input
* Returns Command object according to what user key in
* @param userCommand the command user typed in
* @throws InvalidCommandException if the userCommand is not a valid command
public static Command parse(String userCommand) throws InvalidCommandException {
* A class used for load and save data file
public static final String root = System.getProperty("user.dir");
public static final Path dataPath = Paths.get(root, "data", "duke.txt");
public static final Path dirPath = Paths.get(root, "data");
* Creates new directory and file if dirPath and filePath is not found
* Loads the previous saved data file
* @return tasks ArrayList saved in previous data file
* Saves new tasks to data file
* @param tasks ArrayList of tasks to be saved
* Represents a task type as Deadline task
* @param description String the content of the task
* @param by String the due date or time of the task
* Returns the due date or time of the task
* @return String the due date of time of the task
* Returns a String contains the status, content, due date of time of a task
* Represents a task type as Event task
* @param description String the content of the task
* @param at String the date or time of the event task
* Returns the date or time of the Event task
* @return String the date of time of the Event task
* Returns a String contains the status, content, date of time of an Event task
* @return String representation of an Event task
* Represents a task in an ArrayList
* @param description the content of the task
* Returns the description of the task
* @return String the description of the task
* Returns the current status of the task
* @return String "1" if the task is done, otherwise returns "0"
return (isDone ? "1" : "0"); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task status as done
* Returns a String representation containing status icon and description
* A class represents all operations to the task list
* Constructor of loading a existing TaskList
* @param tasks ArrayList of tasks in the data file
* Returns all the tasks in ArrayList
* Prints all tasks in ArrayList as a list
* Adds a Todo Task to ArrayList tasks
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Adds an Event Task to ArrayList tasks
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty.");
* Adds a Deadline Task to ArrayList tasks
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
* Deletes a task from ArrayList tasks
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The index of the task to be deleted cannot be empty.");
* Marks a task as done in ArrayList tasks
// Mark the relevant task as "done", and print out a line indicates that the task is marked as done
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The index of the task to be marked as done cannot be empty.");
* Finds a task in ArrayList tasks
// Give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The index of the task to be found as done cannot be empty.");
* Represents a task type as Todo task
* @param description String the content of the task
* Returns a String representation of a task containing status icon and description
* A class used for interaction with users
* Prints DUKE logo and greeting message
// the function is used to greet user in the very first beginning
System.out.println("What can I do for you?\n");
* Prints out the whole task list with their status icons
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Prints out the total number of the tasks and what is added to do
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list");
* Exits the program once user key in "bye"
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n");
* Prints out a divider line consist of "-"
* Prints out the message that indicates invalid input
System.out.println("  OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
deadline finish individual project /by no idea :-P
